results.title: Three little words
results.creator_credit: Richard Thorpe, Jack Cummings and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Tin Pan Alley’s legendary songwriting team of Bert Kalmar and Harry Ruby are given the MGM treatment here by Busby Berkeley and musical stars Fred Astaire and Red Skelton, although the film is as much about the performances of the stellar cast as it is about the lives of Kalmar and Ruby. It’s 1919 and vaudeville is in full swing. Bert’s (Astaire) dance career is going well (despite his aspirations to be a musician), ably supported by vaudeville wife Jessie (Vera-Ellen), and obtaining success with numbers such as “Mrs and Mrs Hoofer at Home”. Fate steps in when Bert must take up the more sedentary activity of writing lyrics after injuring his knee. He eventually meets Harry Ruby, a fellow lyricist and frustrated baseball player, and the two pool their talents and reach immediate success writing hits for Broadway and the movies. Their fairytale rise to fame is eventually undone by a trivial misunderstanding, and highlights the rocky nature of their professional and personal relationship. Their future as a successful songwriting team is left in the hands of the women who love them, and who have the potential to reunite them. Cameos are provided by Phil Regan and Harry Mendoza as themselves. Songs include “I Wanna be loved by you”, “Who’s sorry now” and “Thinking of you”.

results.title: The Pirate
results.creator_credit: Vincente Minnelli, Arthur Freed and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Set in the West Indies, a young Manuela (Judy Garland) is told by her aunt Inez that arrangements are being made for her to wed the mysterious new mayor of the town, Don Pedro Vargas (Walter Slezak). Manuela is crushed, as it signals an end to her fantasies of being swept off her feet by the legend of the romantic, yet notorious pirate - Macoco. Being a dutiful surrogate daughter to the aunt and uncle who have been like parents to her, Manuel agrees to the marriage, and they soon take a short trip to the Caribbean island of San Sebastian. As fate will have it, a magician and his troupe arrive in San Sebastian at the same time, ready to perform for the locals. The magician is taken by Manuela’s beauty, and after a failed attempt to seduce her, convinces her to come along to the show. The magician tries to win Manuela’s heart by impersonating the man of her dreams, the pirate Macoco, and during his performance hypnotises then kisses her. Now totally smitten, the “pirate” Serafin follows Manuela home to try and convince her to run away with him, only to be discovered by Don Pedro Vargas, who is recognised by the magician as being the “real” Macoco. Based on the play of the same name by S. N. Behrman, as produced by The Playwrights Producing Company and The Theatre Guild. Cast also includes Gladys Cooper and Reginald Owen. Songs by Cole Porter.

results.title: House of wax
results.creator_credit: Andre De Toth, Bryan Foy and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Professor Henry Jarrod is a renowned wax sculptor who is plunged into madness when an arsonist burns down his wax museum. Jarrod loses his life’s work and, having lost the ability to use his flame-scarred hands, comes up with a new way of stocking his reformed House of Wax in New York. Aided by his mute assistant (Charles Bronson), he dips his victims in wax! Cast includes Vincent Price, Frank Lovejoy, Phyllis Kirk and Carolyn Jones.

results.title: Grand prix
results.creator_credit: John Frankenheimer, Edward Lewis, Cherokee Productions, Joel Productions and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: A race day accident involving Jordan-BRM teammates Pete Aron (James Garner) and Scott Stoddard (Brian Bedford) leaves Stoddard critically injured. During Stoddard’s recovery, Aron becomes involved with his wife (Jessica Walter) who seems determined to leave Scott. At the same time, drivers Jean-Pierre Sarti (Yves Montand) and Nino Barlini (Antonio Sabato) also have chronicled love affairs with Louise Frederickson (Eva Marie Saint), an American journalist, and Lisa (Francoise Hardy). Music by Maurice Jarre. Academy award winner for best editing, sound and sound effects.

results.title: The Strawberry blonde
results.creator_credit: Raoul Walsh, William Cagney and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: We know a few things about Biff Grimes (James Cagney) - he’s married to Amy (Olivia De Havilland), he’s a dentist, he often comes off second best, and he is a one time convict with a short fuse. One Sunday afternoon (the name of the play on which the film is based), a gentleman (Jack Carson) turns up to have his tooth extracted, this sparks an adverse reaction in Grimes, triggering a flashback sequence in which it is revealed that the patient was responsible for sending Grimes to jail, but more painfully that he stole Biff’s girlfriend, Virginia Brush (Rita Hayworth), the eponymous strawberry blonde. As Biff relives the events of years gone by he is forced to re-evaluate his marriage to Amy, a suffragette and best friend of Virginia, and makes a startling discovery. Cast also includes Alan Hale and George Tobias.

results.title: Harum scarum
results.creator_credit: Gene Nelson, Sam Katzman and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: The King’s 19th movie is shot on the original 1925 Cecil B DeMille set from “King of Kings” and features Elvis as matinee idol Johnny Tyrone. When Tyrone is kidnapped en route to the Middle Eastern premier of his latest film, he is launched into an Arabian Nights scenario, complete with chicks, sheikhs, a hostile political environment, and the obligatory damsel in distress (Mary Ann Mobley). He is also asked to take part in a plot to assassinate an Arab king. Features nine songs including “Harem holiday”, “Golden coins”, “Shake that tambourine” and “Go East young man”. Cast also includes Fran Jeffries, Michael Ansara and Jay Novello. The film is alleged to have been made within 18 days.

results.title: Heartbreak ridge
results.brief_description: Gunnery Sergeant Tom Highway (Clint Eastwood), war veteran and Medal of Honor recipient from details in Korea and Vietnam has one last tour of duty prior to his forced retirement from the U.S Marines - training a bunch of new recruits. The brashness of a youth who have experienced war passively through film and literature is incongruous with Tom’s traditional hard nosed ways, yet Tom has proven himself to be a complex character also, as the film follows his attempt to rekindle a past relationship with lines that he too has learnt from books. Tom’s skills for preparing men for battle are put to the test when the recruits experience war for the first time during an invasion of Granada. Cast also includes Marsha Mason, Everett McGill, Moses Gunn, Mario Van Peebles and Eileen Heckart.

results.title: The Music man
results.creator_credit: Morton Da Costa and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: A con artist arrives in River City, Iowa with the intention of duping the townspeople into forming a marching band and acquiring band equipment and musical expertise from him - at a price. He does not have a musical bone in his body however, so the band is unlikely to reach fruition. His plan begins to unravel when he falls for Marion (Shirley Jones), a librarian living in River City. This is the rather simplistic plot that provides a backdrop to the many song and dance routines. Robert Preston reprises his Broadway role as con artist “Professor” Harold Hill. Shirley Jones plays the role performed on stage by Barbara Cook. Includes hits such as “Ya got trouble”, “Till there was you”, “Marion the librarian” and “Seventy six trombones”. Cast also includes Buddy Hackett, Hermione Gingold and Paul Ford. The tape also includes a documentary about the making of ‘The Music man’ - “Right here in River City: the making of ‘The Music Man’”, as well as the original theatrical trailer and an introduction by Shirley Jones.

results.title: Kissin' cousins
results.creator_credit: Gene Nelson, Sam Katzman and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Elvis Presley plays a dual role in this film - Airforce Lieutenant Josh Morgan, and a countrified Jody Tatum. Morgan is sent by the Government on the unenviable job of trying to secure hillbilly land for a proposed missile base. Much to Morgan’s surprise he is faced with a blonde, country version of himself which means double the songs and women. Cast also includes Arthur O’Connell, Glenda Farrell, Jack Albertson and Pam Austin. Includes the following songs; “Kissin cousins”, “Barefoot ballad” and “Tender feeling”.

results.title: Hot potato
results.creator_credit: Oscar Williams, Paul Heller, Fred Weintraub and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Hot Potato is the follow up to “Black Belt Jones!” and sees Jim Kelly reprising his title role. Filmed in Thailand, the film follows the adventures of agent Jones (Kelly) who is sent to Thailand to rescue the daughter of a US Senator kidnapped by a power hungry Thai warlord. Jones teams up with local agent Pam (Irene Tsu), together with his regular sidekicks Chicago (Geoffrey Binney) and Rhino (George Memmoli). Jim Kelly who is an International Middleweight Karate Champion choreographed the film’s fight scenes.
